simple.util.logging

Class LogFactory

  • java.lang.Object
    • simple.util.logging.LogFactory

  • public final class LogFactory
extends java.lang.Object
    Factory for getting and setting logs for specific classes. Default stream is System.out.
    Getting a log: getLogFor(Class), getLogFor(Object)
    Standard way of getting a log:
    Setting a log: private static final Log log = LogFactory.getLogFor(<your class>.class)
    • setGlobalLogFile(File, boolean)
    • setGlobalLogStream(PrintStream)
    • setLogFileFor(Class, File, boolean)
    • setLogStreamFor(Class, PrintStream)
    • setLogFor(Class, Log)
    You can change the log for a class after it has been gotten. Messages logged before the change will not be transferred.
    Created: Oct 21, 2010
    Author:
    Kenneth Pierce
    See Also:
    Log

      • getLogFor

        public static final Log getLogFor(java.lang.Class<?> clazz)

        Parameters:
        clazz - Class you want the Log for
        Returns:
        The log for the class

      • getErrorString

        public static final java.lang.String getErrorString(int code)

        Parameters:
        code - The error code.
        Returns:
        The error string associated with the error code.
